item.title: En: What is K8sCommerce?
item.description:
K8sCommerce Platform

K8sCommerce is a headless ecommerce platform architected from the ground-up to be cloud native and run on Kubernetes. It is comprised of 14 microservices, 2 public/web facing via a JSON REST API, and 12 private/non-web facing RPC services.

Why K8sCommerce?

As of January 2022 no production ready open source projects written in Go and designed for Kubernetes existed.

Today’s most popular open-source ecommerce solutions (WooCommerce - 30% market share, Magento - 9% market share, Bagisto, Drupal commerce, Joomla, OpenCart, Prestashop, OsCommerce, Zencart, X-Cart, etc.) are written in PHP, with many founded 20+ years ago, and are monolithic (all-in-one) software programs that were never designed for the cloud and lack finite resource management

In 2022 the time for a highly-scalable, open source, microservice based ecommerce platform was past due. We need systems that are resource conscientious that automatically adapt in size based on traffic and computing loads. Kubernetes enables adapting / scaling in size but if the majority of open source software available are monolithic leviathans K8s auto scaling cannot break those application into separate services.

JSON REST Gateway Services

There are currently 2 public-facing, RESTful Gateway Services. These external-facing services are intended to be exposed to the internet via a DMZ network. These communicate via JSON over common protocols such as http and https through standardized GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, and DELETE HTTP methods.

Client Gateway Service

The client gateway service exposes all necessary client REST endpoints to facilitate a headless storefront.

  • Microservice overview: client gateway
  • REST endpoints: client REST endpoints

Client gateway endpoints by service:

  • cart endpoints
  • customer endpoints
  • catalog endpoints
  • payments endpoints

Admin Gateway Service

In addition to all client gateway endpoints, the admin gateway exposes all endpoints needed for full administration of the platform and store(s).

  • Microservice overview: admin gateway
  • REST endpoints: admin REST endpoints

Admin gateway endpoints by service:

  • cart endpoints
  • catalog endpoints
  • customer endpoints
  • email endpoints
  • inventory endpoints
  • others bought endpoints
  • payment endpoints
  • shipping endpoints
  • similar products endpoints
  • store endpoints
  • user endpoints
  • warehouse endpoints

item.title: En: Cart
item.description:
Cart Endpoints

admin

Method URI Name Summary
POST /v1/cart/{customerId} add item to cart Add Item to Cart
DELETE /v1/cart/{customerId} clear cart Clear Cart
GET /v1/cart/{customerId} get cart Get Cart
DELETE /v1/cart/{customerId}/{sku} remove cart item Remove Item
PUT /v1/cart/{customerId}/{sku} update cart item quantity Update Item Quantity

Paths

Add Item to Cart (addItemToCart)

POST /v1/cart/{customerId}

adds an item to an existing cart

Parameters

Name Source Type Go type Separator Required Default Description
customerId path string string âœ“ a customer’s id
body body AddItemToCartRequest models.AddItemToCartRequest âœ“

All responses

Code Status Description Has headers Schema
200 OK A successful response. schema

Responses

200 - A successful response.

Status: OK

Schema

AddItemToCartResponse

Clear Cart (clearCart)

DELETE /v1/cart/{customerId}

clear a customer’s cart

Parameters

Name Source Type Go type Separator Required Default Description
customerId path string string âœ“ a customer’s id
body body ClearCartRequest models.ClearCartRequest âœ“

All responses

Code Status Description Has headers Schema
200 OK A successful response. schema

Responses

200 - A successful response.

Status: OK

Schema

ClearCartResponse

Get Cart (getCart)

GET /v1/cart/{customerId}

returns a shopping cart if one exists

Parameters

Name Source Type Go type Separator Required Default Description
customerId path string string âœ“ a customer’s id

All responses

Code Status Description Has headers Schema
200 OK A successful response. schema

Responses

200 - A successful response.

Status: OK

Schema

GetCartResponse

Remove Item (removeCartItem)

DELETE /v1/cart/{customerId}/{sku}

removes an item from a customer’s cart

Parameters

Name Source Type Go type Separator Required Default Description
customerId path string string âœ“ a customer’s id
sku path string string âœ“ an Item’s sku
body body RemoveCartItemRequest models.RemoveCartItemRequest âœ“

All responses

Code Status Description Has headers Schema
200 OK A successful response. schema

Responses

200 - A successful response.

Status: OK

Schema

RemoveCartItemResponse

Update Item Quantity (updateCartItemQuantity)

PUT /v1/cart/{customerId}/{sku}

updates a cart item’s quantity

Parameters

Name Source Type Go type Separator Required Default Description
customerId path string string âœ“ a customer’s id
sku path string string âœ“ an item’s sku
body body UpdateCartItemQuantityRequest models.UpdateCartItemQuantityRequest âœ“

All responses

Code Status Description Has headers Schema
200 OK A successful response. schema

Responses

200 - A successful response.

Status: OK

Schema

UpdateCartItemQuantityResponse

Models

AddItemToCartRequest

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
customerId int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“ a customer’s id
item Item Item âœ“ an Item object

AddItemToCartResponse

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
cart Cart Cart âœ“ a Cart object
status ResponseStatus ResponseStatus âœ“ a ResponseStatus object

Cart

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
items []Item []*Item âœ“ a collection of Item
totalPrice double (formatted number) float64 âœ“ the sum total of the cart

ClearCartRequest

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
customerId int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“ a customer’s id
status ResponseStatus ResponseStatus âœ“ a ResponseStatus object

ClearCartResponse

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
status ResponseStatus ResponseStatus âœ“ a ResponseStatus object

GetCartRequest

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
customerId int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“ a customer’s id

GetCartResponse

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
cart Cart Cart âœ“ a Cart object
status ResponseStatus ResponseStatus âœ“ a ResponseStatus object

Item

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
expiresAt string string âœ“ when this item expires in the cart
price double (formatted number) float64 âœ“ the item’s price
quantity int32 (formatted integer) int32 âœ“ how many of identical items
sku string string âœ“ an item’s variant sku number

JwtToken

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
access_expire int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“
access_token string string âœ“
refresh_after int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“

RemoveCartItemRequest

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
customerId int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“ a customer’s id
quanity int32 (formatted integer) int32 âœ“ a new quantity
sku string string âœ“ an item’s variant sku number

RemoveCartItemResponse

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
cart Cart Cart âœ“ a Cart object
status ResponseStatus ResponseStatus âœ“ a ResponseStatus object

ResponseStatus

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
statusCode int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“ RFC http status code, ie. 204, etc - https:go.dev/src/net/http/status.go
statusMessage string string âœ“ status message

UpdateCartItemQuantityRequest

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
customerId int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“ a customer’s id
quanity int32 (formatted integer) int32 âœ“ a new quantity
sku string string âœ“ an item’s variant sku number

UpdateCartItemQuantityResponse

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
cart Cart Cart âœ“ a Cart object
status ResponseStatus ResponseStatus âœ“ a ResponseStatus object

item.title: En: Catalog
item.description:
Catalog Endpoints

admin

Method URI Name Summary
POST /v1/category create category Create Category
POST /v1/product create product Create Product
DELETE /v1/category/{id} delete category Delete Category
DELETE /v1/product/{id} delete product Delete Product
GET /v1/categories get all categories Get All Categories
GET /v1/products/{currentPage}/{pageSize} get all products Get All Products
GET /v1/category/{id} get category by Id Get Category By Id
GET /v1/category/slug/{slug} get category by slug Get Category By Slug
GET /v1/product/{id} get product by Id Get Product By Id
GET /v1/product/sku/{sku} get product by sku Get Product By Sku
GET /v1/product/slug/{slug} get product by slug Get Product By Slug
GET /v1/products/{categoryId}/{currentPage}/{pageSize} get products by category Id Get Products By Category Id
PUT /v1/category/{id} update category Update Category
PUT /v1/product/{id} update product Update Product

Paths

Create Category (createCategory)

POST /v1/category

creates a category

Parameters

Name Source Type Go type Separator Required Default Description
body body CreateCategoryRequest models.CreateCategoryRequest âœ“

All responses

Code Status Description Has headers Schema
200 OK A successful response. schema

Responses

Status: OK

Schema

Models

Category

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example

id int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“ category id
metaDescription string string âœ“ metatag description for SEO
metaKeywords string string âœ“ metatag keywords for SEO
metaTitle string string âœ“ metatag title for SEO
name string string âœ“ name of category
parentId int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“ parent category id. references Category.Id
slug string string âœ“ slug name of the category
sortOrder int32 (formatted integer) int32 âœ“ sort order of menu items on the same level and same parent id

category Category Category âœ“

status ResponseStatus ResponseStatus âœ“ a ResponseStatus object

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
status ResponseStatus ResponseStatus âœ“ a ResponseStatus object

path:omitempty int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
categories []Category []*Category âœ“ a collection of Category
status ResponseStatus ResponseStatus âœ“ a ResponseStatus object

GetCategoryByIdRequest

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
id int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example

status ResponseStatus ResponseStatus âœ“ a ResponseStatus object

GetCategoryBySlugRequest

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example

status ResponseStatus ResponseStatus âœ“ a ResponseStatus object

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example

GetProductBySkuRequest

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example

GetProductBySlugRequest

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example

status ResponseStatus ResponseStatus âœ“ a ResponseStatus object

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example

currentPage int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“
pageSize int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“
sortOn string string

GetProductsByCategoryIdResponse

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
products []Product []*Product âœ“
status ResponseStatus ResponseStatus âœ“ a ResponseStatus object
totalPages int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“
totalRecords int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“

JwtToken

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
access_expire int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“
access_token string string âœ“
refresh_after int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“

Price

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
amount double (formatted number) float64 âœ“ price amount
compareAtAmount double (formatted number) float64 âœ“ price compare amount
currency string string âœ“ price currency. example: USD, CAN, etc.
displayAmount string string âœ“ price display amount
displayCompareAtAmount string string âœ“ price display compare amount
id int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“ price id

Product

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
description string string âœ“ category description
id int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“ product id
metaDescription string string âœ“ metatag description for SEO
metaKeywords string string âœ“ metatag keywords for SEO
metaTitle string string âœ“ metatag title for SEO
name string string âœ“ product name
shortDescription string string âœ“ product short description. used in category pages
slug string string âœ“ product slug
variants []Variant []*Variant âœ“ collection of Variant objects

ResponseStatus

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
statusCode int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“ RFC http status code, ie. 204, etc - https:go.dev/src/net/http/status.go
statusMessage string string âœ“ status message

UpdateCategoryRequest

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
category Category Category âœ“
id int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“

UpdateCategoryResponse

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
category Category Category âœ“
status ResponseStatus ResponseStatus âœ“ a ResponseStatus object

UpdateProductRequest

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
path:omitempty int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“
product:omitempty Product Product âœ“

UpdateProductResponse

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
product:omitempty Product Product âœ“
status ResponseStatus ResponseStatus âœ“ a ResponseStatus object

Variant

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
depth double (formatted number) float64 âœ“ variant depth. used in calculating shipping
height double (formatted number) float64 âœ“ variant height. used in calculating shipping
id int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“ variant id
isDefault boolean (formatted boolean) bool âœ“ is default variant. each product must have exactly 1 default variant
price Price Price âœ“ variant Price object
sku string string âœ“ variant sku. usually the product sku with appended identification tags
weight double (formatted number) float64 âœ“ variant weight. used in calculating shipping
width double (formatted number) float64 âœ“ variant width. used in calculating shipping

Price

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example

Product

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
description string string âœ“ category description
id int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“ product id
metaDescription string string âœ“ metatag description for SEO

metaTitle string string âœ“ metatag title for SEO
name string string âœ“ product name
shortDescription string string âœ“ product short description. used in category pages
slug string string âœ“ product slug
variants []Variant []*Variant âœ“ collection of Variant objects

ResponseStatus

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
statusCode int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“ RFC http status code, ie. 204, etc - https:go.dev/src/net/http/status.go
statusMessage string string âœ“ status message

Variant

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
depth double (formatted number) float64 âœ“ variant depth. used in calculating shipping
height double (formatted number) float64 âœ“ variant height. used in calculating shipping
id int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“ variant id
isDefault boolean (formatted boolean) bool âœ“ is default variant. each product must have exactly 1 default variant
price Price Price âœ“ variant Price object
sku string string âœ“ variant sku. usually the product sku with appended identification tags
weight double (formatted number) float64 âœ“ variant weight. used in calculating shipping
width double (formatted number) float64 âœ“ variant width. used in calculating shipping

item.title: En: Development Philosophy
item.description:
The K8sCommerce project embraces the development philosophy:

“Prefer tools over conventions."

Employing code-generation tools as often as possible reduces repetitively writing foundational code such as CRUD operations, gRPC bindings, microservice boilerplate code. etc. This methodology shortens the developer’s learning curve while reducing, and oftentimes eliminating, human-introduced bugs.

Incorporating the following code-generation tools in our project has helped speed up development, integrations, and logic refinements, creating a desirable, streamlined, high-velocity development approach.

  • Google’s protocol buffers (protoc): RPC client/server generation from .proto files with almost every language supported
  • go-zero’s goctl: microservice framework generation from .proto and .api files
  • xo’s xo: Database CRUD object generation for relational databases, with primary key, foreign key, enum, and advanced composite primary key support.

Preferring tools over conventions, combined with ever-growing documentation, empowers businesses to successfully integrate K8sCommerce’s projects into their existing coding ecosystem in condensed timeframes.

item.title: En: Customer
item.description:
Customer Endpoints

admin

Method URI Name Summary
POST /v1/customer create customer Create Customer
POST /v1/customer/login customer login Login

Paths

Create Customer (createCustomer)

POST /v1/customer

creates a new customer

Parameters

Name Source Type Go type Separator Required Default Description
body body CreateCustomerRequest models.CreateCustomerRequest âœ“

All responses

Code Status Description Has headers Schema
200 OK A successful response. schema

Responses

200 - A successful response.

Status: OK

Schema

CreateCustomerResponse

Login (customerLogin)

POST /v1/customer/login

login for customers

Parameters

Name Source Type Go type Separator Required Default Description
body body CustomerLoginRequest models.CustomerLoginRequest âœ“

All responses

Code Status Description Has headers Schema
200 OK A successful response. schema

Responses

200 - A successful response.

Status: OK

Schema

CustomerLoginResponse

Models

Address

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
city string string âœ“ city name
country string string âœ“ IISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. https:en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_3166_country_codes
isDefault boolean (formatted boolean) bool âœ“ indicates if this is a default address
postalCode string string âœ“ postal or zip code
stateProvince string string âœ“ state or province name
street string string âœ“ street name, ie: 1723 NW 23rd Ave.

CreateCustomerRequest

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
customer NewCustomer NewCustomer âœ“ NewCustomer object

CreateCustomerResponse

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
customer Customer Customer âœ“ Customer object
status ResponseStatus ResponseStatus âœ“ a ResponseStatus object

Customer

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
email string string âœ“ email address
firstName string string âœ“ first name
id int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“ customer id
lastName string string âœ“ last or given name
password string string âœ“ password

CustomerAccount

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
billingAddress Address Address âœ“ Address object
id int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“ customer id
shippingAddresses []Address []*Address âœ“ collection of Address objects

CustomerLoginRequest

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
email string string âœ“ email address, unique to each store id
password string string âœ“ password

CustomerLoginResponse

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
customer Customer Customer âœ“ Customer object

status ResponseStatus ResponseStatus âœ“ a ResponseStatus object

JwtToken

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
access_expire int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“
access_token string string âœ“
refresh_after int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“

NewCustomer

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
billingAddress Address Address Address object
email string string âœ“ email address, unique per store id
firstName string string âœ“ first name
lastName string string âœ“ last or given name
password string string âœ“ password
shippingAddresses Address Address Address object

ResponseStatus

Properties

Name Type Go type Required Default Description Example
statusCode int64 (formatted integer) int64 âœ“ RFC http status code, ie. 204, etc - https:go.dev/src/net/http/status.go
statusMessage string string âœ“ status message
